name: Mixed Security, Logic, and Quality Issues
expected_findings: Weak cryptographic hash algorithm (MD5) used for password hashing in create_user
Cryptographically insecure random number generator (random.randint) used for token generation
Weak session validation in validate_session - only checks if token exists, not authenticity or expiry
validate_email always returns True without any actual email validation logic
get_users calls undefined method fetch_user which will cause AttributeError at runtime
Missing salt when hashing passwords in create_user
Token generation only uses digits (0-9) resulting in weak token space
validate_session can be simplified to return bool(token)
Missing docstrings for both classes and all methods
Missing error handling in get_users for when fetch_user fails
No validation that count parameter in get_users is positive
Missing test coverage for create_user including password hashing verification, edge cases for inputs
Missing test coverage for generate_token including uniqueness, randomness quality, token strength
Missing test coverage for validate_email including valid/invalid email formats, edge cases
Missing test coverage for get_users including undefined fetch_user error, negative count, empty results
Missing test coverage for validate_session including empty strings, None, expired tokens, forged tokens
